title: react-navigation is no longer supported
body:
### Environment

<!--
  Please fill in all the relevant fields by running these commands in terminal.
-->

1. `react-native -v`: 0.57.5
2. `npm ls rnpm-plugin-windows`:  0.2.8
3. `npm ls react-native-windows`: 0.57.0-rc.0
4. `node -v`: 10.9.0
5. `npm -v`: 6.2.0

- Target Platform: UWP

- Target Platform Version(s): UWP - 10.0.14393, .NET 4.6.1

- Target Device(s): Desktop

- Development Operating System: Windows 10

- Visual Studio Version: VS 2017

- Build Configuration: Debug

### Steps to Reproduce

1. install fresh react-native proj
2. install windows plugin
3. npm install react-navigation
4. run app

### Expected Behavior
Application should load without problems

### Actual Behavior
Error when loading package: Unable to resolve module gestureHandlerRootHOC. There seems to be a dependency on react-native-gesture-handler which does not support UWP.

### Reproducible Demo
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3212505/49523511-f5985d00-f877-11e8-9b29-9283288338a0.png)

title: Enable the CLI to create a C# native module library that consumes Microsoft.ReactNative

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
Project should be set up similar to the SampleLibraryCS sample:

- [ ] C# component library
- [ ] Depends only on Microsoft.ReactNative and Microsoft.ReactNative.Managed
- [ ] Provides a ReactPackageProvider that automatically includes all native modules, and view managers
- [ ] Provides a simple sample native module

title: Ensure RNWCPP works with CodePush

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Currently, there is not an easy, documented way to hook up and use CodePush with our React Native Windows vnext implementation (or even possible to yet?).

It would be good to have that tested to ensure it *can* work, and then a PM to document what's needed to get it *to* work.

title: added event handler for displayinformation
body:
Hey all, 

I tried to add orientation support for issue #3595 by firing the displayinformation event (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/uwp/api/windows.graphics.display.displayinformation.orientationchanged) but I am unsure if I did it correctly at all. 

Can someone take a look and guide me in the right place? 

Thanks. 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](http://wpcp.azurewebsites.net/CodeFlowProtocolProxy2.php?pullrequest=https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/pull/3679)

title: attempt by method 'Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings.."cctor()" to access field 'Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings.DefaultContext' failed.
body:
### Environment

1. `react-native -v`:
react-native-cli: 2.0.1
react-native: 0.59.10
2. `npm ls rnpm-plugin-windows`:
rnpm-plugin-windows@0.3.5
3. `npm ls react-native-windows`:
react-native-windows@0.59.0-rc.3
4. `node -v`:
v10.16.3
5. `npm -v`:
6.9.0
6. `yarn --version`<!-- (if you use Yarn) -->:
1.19.1
SDK version 
10.0.14393.795
- Target Platform Version(s):
Windows IOT boards
- Target Device(s):
Desktop, Windows IOT boards

- Visual Studio Version:
2019
- Build Configuration:
Debug

1. react-native init <project name> --version 0.59.10
2. cd <project name>
3. npm install --save-dev rnpm-plugin-windows
4. react-native windows
5. react-native run-windows
6. Close CMD, and app emulator then 
7. Re-run react-native run-windows
### Expected Behavior
The app local emulator runs as before 
### Actual Behavior
Red screen with error 
attempt by method 'Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings.."cctor()" to access field 'Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializerSettings.DefaultContext' failed.

![Screenshot (4)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54540616/66837938-1e8f8100-ef64-11e9-8b6e-85d7704302a6.png)


### Additional context
It seems un-checking "Enable the visual studio hosting process" helps most people URL: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7066726/attempt-by-method-system-web-helpers-json-cctor-to-access-method-system-we. I can't seem to find this option in Visual Studio 2019.

title: Support react-native-svg for RNW vNext

labels.name: Extensions
labels.description: Tracks issues against community modules and extensions

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-svg

A lot of our app leverages stuff from react-native-svg and it's variety of views.  For drawing gradients, vector graphics, on screen controls, and misc other things. 

This has been a huge pain point for us trying to work around. As some of our buttons are deeply integrated with this, and we currently have no easy way of working around it.

title: [Releases] Figure out binary distribution story for RNW

milestone.title: WinUI3 (vNext M6)
milestone.description: This milestone builds upon MVP to leverage [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3) to fill in the feature gaps and complete implementation of RNW core APIs.

body:
We need to establish a plan for how the solution will be released. We know that JavaScript related to react-native-windows will continue to be published on NPM, but we have a few options for how we publish native code. We can use the following questions to guide the plan:

1. Will we ship the native bridge implementation for React Native as source code or compiled binaries?
2. If compiled, will we ship the binaries on NPM alongside the JavaScript?
3. If compiled, and if not shipping binaries with JavaScript on NPM, will we ship the compiled binaries on NuGet, vcpkg, or some other package management service?
4. If compiled, and if not shipping binaries with JavaScript on NPM, what will be the versioning scheme to align compatibility between JavaScript released on NPM and native binaries shipped on some package management service?

title: Optimize away unnecessary XAML Panels for Views

milestone.title: WinUI3 (vNext M6)
milestone.description: This milestone builds upon MVP to leverage [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3) to fill in the feature gaps and complete implementation of RNW core APIs.

body:
One of the optimizations we have in the C# solution is to "optimize away" some of the React components that are purely used for layout. It turns out there are usually quite a lot of these in a typical React Native app. This would help as you would reduce the number of views doing the unnecessary Measure/Arrange work.

This is the approach that was taken for Android, although I'm not sure if it will go away with the introduction of "Fabric". Here is the code in C# for using the shadow node hierarchy to optimize away native views that would be purely used for layout:
https://github.com/Microsoft/react-native-windows/blob/master/ReactWindows/ReactNative.Shared/UIManager/NativeViewHierarchyOptimizer.cs

title: Desktop integration tests should dynamically load RNW
body:
Currently, project `React.Windows.Desktop.IntegrationTests` consumes `React.Windows.Desktop` instead of `React.Windows.Desktop.DLL`.

Change this to make integration testing work on a component to component base.

title: ScrollView stickyHeaderIndices

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
Split out from #2113
_An array of child indices determining which children get docked to the top of the screen when scrolling. For example, passing `stickyHeaderIndices={[0]}` will cause the first child to be fixed to the top of the scroll view. This property is not supported in conjunction with `horizontal={true}`._
Not directly supported by ScrollViewer. Seems difficult. Needs deep dive.

title: Text component in rnwcpp shouldn't clip at 200%

milestone.title: MVP (vNext M4)
milestone.description:
This "MVP" milestone tracks implementation of as much of RN core without significant workarounds current XAML (which would require [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3)).

- vNext is the default template (with vCurrent available as a fallback for compat for existing apps)
- Native Modules ready to be developed
- Measured percentage of lean core API completion (specific target percentage TBD)
- Built on [WinUI 2.x](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/)

body:
When users choose to make text bigger in their Ease of Access display settings on Windows, the size of the characters increases but the line height does not. Text quickly becomes completely illegible because it's clipped.

This issue is related to the allowFontScaling prop mentioned in #2121

title: Add support for device orientation

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
RN4W is missing support for the "namedOrientationDidChange" event, which is supposed to be raised when the device orientation changes.

Currently, the Modal component uses this event, but apps are also free to subscribe to the event for other reasons.

See:
https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/modal#onorientationchange
https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/modal#supportedorientations

react-native-cookies is not supported for windows. It throws error like it supports only ios and android. 

is there  any alternate for this library or do we any solution for cookie storage?

title: Sample App doesn't work well in Dark Theme

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
### Environment

<!--
  Please fill in all the relevant fields by running these commands in terminal.
-->

1. `react-native -v`: react-native-cli: 2.0.1
react-native: 0.59.0-microsoft.11
2. `npm ls rnpm-plugin-windows`: react-native-windows@0.59.0-vnext.83 D:\React_Native_Windows\react-native-windows\vnext
`-- (empty)
3. `npm ls react-native-windows`: react-native-windows@0.59.0-vnext.83 D:\React_Native_Windows\react-native-windows\vnext
`-- (empty)
4. `node -v`: v10.16.0
5. `npm -v`: 6.9.0
6. `yarn --version`<!-- (if you use Yarn) -->: 1.16.0


- Visual Studio Version: 2017
- Build Configuration: Debug x64

### Steps to Reproduce
In Universal Sample App
Set Windows Theme to dark
or update App.xaml to include  RequestedTheme="Dark"
### Expected Behavior

The samples should work with dark theme and the text should be readable

### Actual Behavior
Styling is wrong in many examples. Text is not readable (White on white background)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387006/61069993-6b424980-a3c2-11e9-852c-21eae966c436.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387006/61069890-27e7db00-a3c2-11e9-8ad2-1a5f3ef3ac2b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387006/61069896-2f0ee900-a3c2-11e9-941d-d6e9f5882c6b.png)


### Additional context

Temporarily forcing sample app to be in Light theme in [Updated Flyout to attach as ContextFlyout on Target](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/pull/2744)

title: Optimize SolidColorBrush usage

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Thus it will not achieve 100% core parity, but will increase completion.

Items of note:
- Match lean core (moving components out to extensions)
- Turbo Module support

body:
When setting solid color brushes, a new SolidColorBrush is always created.  

See ValueUtils.cpp => SolidColorBrushFrom() utility function

Can we optimize this?  Ideas:
1) Share SolidColorBrushes that have the same color
2) Only create SolidColorBrush if we haven't already created one, otherwise set the color on the existing brush

https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/image#defaultsource

_A static image to display while loading the image source._
Not directly supported by Image. Would need to manually load/display this, similar to loadingIndicatorSource (#2633).

title: Image loadingIndicatorSource

milestone.title: MVP+ (vNext M5)
milestone.description:
After completing a MVP and moving vNext as the default template, this milestone covers work to fill out as much functionality as possible without requiring [WinUI 3](https://github.com/microsoft/microsoft-ui-xaml/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md#winui-3). Items of note:

- Turbo Module support

body:
Split out from #2111
https://facebook.github.io/react-native/docs/image#loadingindicatorsource

_Similarly to source, this property represents the resource used to render the loading indicator for the image, displayed until image is ready to be displayed, typically after when it got downloaded from network._

Not directly supported by Image. Would need to manually load/display the loading indicator image and switch to the real image when it's ready. There is likely open-source code for this that could be borrowed.
